result.execSummary:
The defendant Keonna T Nord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 9/21/2022.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 9/21/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.

-No use or possession of firearms. 
-No contact with Walmart in Brown Deer.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keonna T Nord

records.addlTxt: Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Keonna T Nord.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case called to address sentencing modification. Court extends time to provide DNA sample to 3:00 pm on 9/23/2022.

Defendant Keonna T Nord in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Keonna T Nord.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 9 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
*-Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on 9/21/2022.  
*-Complete 20 hours of community service.
*-No use or possession of firearms. 
*-No contact with Walmart in Brown Deer.

*-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*-Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 9/21/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
*-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Keonna T Nord in court with attorney Maryann Corea on behalf of Sam Obscherning. Sarah Dahdouh on behalf of John Chisholm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Status conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, requests case be set for Plea/Sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 30. Hearing held IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keonna T Nord in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keonna T Nord appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer. Defense requests status conference. 
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case rescheduled off the record due to judge unavailability.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keonna T Nord in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keonna T Nord appeared by video means. Case in court for status of counsel. Defendant does qualify for public defender representation. Case is adjourned to Br. 30 following appointment of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keonna T Nord in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keonna T Nord appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Court orders defendant to report to public defenders office to be evaluated.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keonna T Nord in court.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/22 @ 2p
